Destination Guides

Explored 48 unique destinations across 3 countries

Places I've explored during my travels since 2016, with personal insights and recommendations.

India

üè∞ Jaipur

The Pink City with its magnificent palaces, vibrant markets, and rich cultural heritage.

üèõÔ∏è Jodhpur

The Blue City famous for its mighty Mehrangarh Fort and vibrant old city streets.

üèØ Udaipur

The City of Lakes with its romantic palaces, serene lakes, and rich Rajasthani culture.

üê™ Jaisalmer

The Golden City with its living fort, desert safaris, and stunning Rajasthani architecture.

‚õ©Ô∏è Pushkar

Sacred town known for its holy lake, Brahma Temple, and annual camel fair.

üèõÔ∏è Bikaner

Historic city known for its magnificent forts, temples, and traditional cuisine.

‚õ∞Ô∏è Mount Abu

Rajasthan's only hill station offering stunning views and Dilwara Jain Temples.

üèõÔ∏è Bhangarh

Historical ruins known for its archaeological heritage and mysterious legends.

üïå Ajmer

Spiritual city home to the famous Ajmer Sharif Dargah and ancient architecture.

üóª Nag Tibba

Popular weekend trek near Mussoorie offering panoramic views of Himalayan peaks.

üïâÔ∏è Haridwar

Ancient holy city on the Ganges, famous for its evening Ganga Aarti and spiritual significance.

üßò Rishikesh

World's yoga capital with adventure sports, spiritual retreats, and the sacred Ganges.

‚õ∞Ô∏è Chandrashila/Tungnath

Highest Shiva temple trek offering spectacular views of Himalayan ranges.

üèîÔ∏è Mussoorie

Queen of Hills with colonial charm, mountain views, and pleasant weather.

üèõÔ∏è Jalandhar

Historic city in Punjab known for its sports industry and cultural heritage.

üèîÔ∏è Dalhousie

Colonial-era hill station with panoramic views of the Himalayas and pine valleys.

‚õ∞Ô∏è Triund

Popular trek offering breathtaking views of the Dhauladhar range.

üèõÔ∏è Shimla

Former summer capital of British India with colonial architecture and mountain charm.

‚ô®Ô∏è Kheerganga

Scenic trek leading to natural hot springs amidst the Parvati Valley.

üèîÔ∏è Chitkul

India's last inhabited village near the Indo-Tibet border with stunning mountain views.

‚õµ Kochi

Historic coastal city with Chinese fishing nets, colonial architecture, and vibrant culture.

üö£ Alleppey

Venice of the East known for its backwaters, houseboats, and serene canals.

Hill station surrounded by rolling hills and vast tea plantations.

üåä Kanyakumari

India's southernmost tip where three oceans meet, famous for stunning sunrises and sunsets.

Temple town with pristine beaches and laid-back atmosphere.

üåä Mangalore

Coastal city known for its beaches, temples, and unique cuisine.

üïâÔ∏è Udupi

Temple town famous for its Krishna Temple and South Indian cuisine.

üèä Mulki

Coastal town known for its serene beaches and water sports.

‚õ∞Ô∏è Kudremukha

Singapore

üåÜ Marina Bay

Iconic waterfront district with Gardens by the Bay, Marina Bay Sands, and stunning city views.

Historic district with temples, traditional shophouses, and diverse culinary scene.

üõçÔ∏è Orchard Road

Premier shopping district with modern malls, boutiques, and entertainment venues.

üïâÔ∏è Little India

Vibrant neighborhood with Indian culture, temples, and authentic cuisine.

Malaysia

üåÜ Kuala Lumpur

Modern capital with iconic Petronas Towers, diverse culture, and excellent food scene.

‚õ∞Ô∏è Batu Caves

Limestone caves and Hindu temple complex with massive golden statue and monkeys.

üèÆ Petaling Street

Historic Chinatown area with street food, markets, and cultural heritage.

üå≥ KLCC Park

Urban park with jogging trails, lake, and stunning views of the Petronas Towers.
